title: Quarterly Earnings Watch - S&T Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ:STBA)
text:
Home » Analyst Views » Quarterly Earnings Watch –   Quarterly Earnings Watch –   on September 30, 2015 
  is expected to next issue their quarterly announcement on or around 2015-10-27. This is based on the most recent information made available by the firm. The Zacks consensus EPS number currently sits at $0.58 for the current quarter. Zack’s number can sometimes slightly differ from the First Call EPS estimates. Buy-side institutions and retail investors alike will be closely monitoring the direction of this estimate and the revisions as the earnings date approaches. 
  most recently posted earnings of $0.52 per share for their fiscal quarter which closed on 2015-06-30. The actual number was $0.03 away from the Zacks consensus number calculated immediately prior to the release of earnings materials, or a surprise factor of 6.12%. 
Publicly traded firms can feel intense pressure to meet or beat the First Call or Zacks consensus estimates. When a firm consistently beats Wall Street estimates, investors are often rewarded by a higher share price over time. On the other hand, the stock price can be punished when a company repeatedly fails to meet or exceed what research firms are expecting. 
Stock Price Target 
Sell-side firms covering the company, have a 12-month price target of $31.666 on the stock. This is according to the 3 analysts polled by Zacks which are taken into account to arrive at the average. The most positive analyst view sees the stock reaching $32. On the other hand, the most conservative analyst report has a $31 price target on the name. 
Zacks compiles analyst recommendations into a simplified scale due to the complexity of the various methods and terminology of research firms. The scale provides an Average Broker Rating based on a 1 to 5 sliding scale where 1 signifies a Strong Buy and 5 a Strong Sell recommendation. S&T Bancorp, Inc. currently has an average broker rating of 2.8. The stock had a rating of 2.8 three months ago. 
Immediate Sentiment 
Alpha One provides analytics on stock sentiment analysis based on a news stories and articles from the most important and impactful sources on the internet. The algorithm can help identify how impactful stock news and sentiment can be on a firm’s share price. Each stock is given a daily rating of -1 to 1 based on how negative or positive the news is perceived to be. The sentiment score for S&T Bancorp, Inc. was 0 for stories published on 2015-09-30. Alpha One also calculates a daily impact score on each stock which is based on a 1-100 scale which calculates the likelihood that a stock will move more than 1% on news. The Impact Score for the firm on 2015-09-30 was 0. 
Shares of S&T Bancorp, Inc. traded in the range of $32.46 to $32.88 and closed the most recent session at $32.56. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. (S&T) is a bank holding company and has three wholly owned subsidiaries, S&T Bank, 9th Street Holdings, Inc. and STBA Capital Trust I. The Company also owns certain interest in Commonwealth Trust Credit Life Insurance Company. As of December 31, 2012, the Company had approximately .4 billion in loans and .6 billion in deposits. S&T Bank is a full service bank. It provides its services to its customers through offices located in Allegheny, Armstrong, Blair, Butler, Cambria, Clarion, Clearfield, Indiana, Jefferson and Westmoreland counties of Pennsylvania. It operates in three segments: Community Banking, Wealth Management and Insurance. Its Community Banking segment offers services, which include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, originating commercial and consumer loans, and providing letters of credit and credit card services. The Wealth Management segment offers discount brokerage services, services as executor and trustee under wills and deeds.
